capture.name: capture
capture.short_desc: Create a new Illuminate HTTP request from server variables.

root.name: root
root.short_desc: Get the root URL for the application.

url.name: url
url.short_desc: Get the URL (no query string) for the request.

fullUrl.name: fullUrl
fullUrl.short_desc: Get the full URL for the request.

fullUrlWithQuery.name: fullUrlWithQuery
fullUrlWithQuery.short_desc: Get the full URL for the request with the added query string parameters.

path.name: path
path.short_desc: Get the current path info for the request.

decodedPath.name: decodedPath
decodedPath.short_desc: Get the current decoded path info for the request.

segment.name: segment
segment.short_desc: Get a segment from the URI (1 based index).

segments.name: segments
segments.short_desc: Get all of the segments for the request path.

is.name: is
is.short_desc: Determine if the current request URI matches a pattern.

routeIs.name: routeIs
routeIs.short_desc: Determine if the route name matches a given pattern.

fullUrlIs.name: fullUrlIs
fullUrlIs.short_desc: Determine if the current request URL and query string matches a pattern.

ajax.name: ajax
ajax.short_desc: Determine if the request is the result of an AJAX call.

pjax.name: pjax
pjax.short_desc: Determine if the request is the result of an PJAX call.

secure.name: secure
secure.short_desc: Determine if the request is over HTTPS.

merge.name: merge
merge.short_desc: Merge new input into the current request's input array.

replace.name: replace
replace.short_desc: Replace the input for the current request.

get.name: get
get.short_desc: This method belongs to Symfony HttpFoundation and is not usually needed when using Laravel.
get.long_desc: Instead, you may use the "input" method.

json.name: json
json.short_desc: Get the JSON payload for the request.

createFrom.name: createFrom
createFrom.short_desc: Create a new request instance from the given Laravel request.

createFromBase.name: createFromBase
createFromBase.short_desc: Create an Illuminate request from a Symfony instance.

duplicate.name: duplicate
duplicate.short_desc: Clones a request and overrides some of its parameters.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.short_desc: The request attributes (parameters parsed from the PATH_INFO, ...)

session.name: session
session.short_desc: Get the session associated with the request.

getSession.name: getSession
getSession.short_desc: Get the session associated with the request.

setLaravelSession.name: setLaravelSession
setLaravelSession.short_desc: Set the session instance on the request.

user.name: user
user.short_desc: Get the user making the request.

route.name: route
route.short_desc: Get the route handling the request.

fingerprint.name: fingerprint
fingerprint.short_desc: Get a unique fingerprint for the request / route / IP address.

setJson.name: setJson
setJson.short_desc: Set the JSON payload for the request.

toArray.name: toArray
toArray.short_desc: Get all of the input and files for the request.

offsetExists.name: offsetExists
offsetExists.short_desc: Determine if the given offset exists.

offsetGet.name: offsetGet
offsetGet.short_desc: Get the value at the given offset.

offsetSet.name: offsetSet
offsetSet.short_desc: Set the value at the given offset.

offsetUnset.name: offsetUnset
offsetUnset.short_desc: Remove the value at the given offset.

initialize.name: initialize
initialize.short_desc: Sets the parameters for this request.
initialize.long_desc: This method also re-initializes all properties.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.short_desc: The request attributes (parameters parsed from the PATH_INFO, ...)

createFromGlobals.name: createFromGlobals
createFromGlobals.short_desc: Creates a new request with values from PHP's super globals.

create.name: create
create.short_desc: Creates a Request based on a given URI and configuration.
create.long_desc:
The information contained in the URI always take precedence
over the other information (server and parameters).

setFactory.name: setFactory
setFactory.short_desc: Sets a callable able to create a Request instance.
setFactory.long_desc:
This is mainly useful when you need to override the Request class
to keep BC with an existing system. It should not be used for any
other purpose.

overrideGlobals.name: overrideGlobals
overrideGlobals.short_desc: Overrides the PHP global variables according to this request instance.
overrideGlobals.long_desc:
It overrides $_GET, $_POST, $_REQUEST, $_SERVER, $_COOKIE.
$_FILES is never overridden, see rfc1867

setTrustedProxies.name: setTrustedProxies
setTrustedProxies.short_desc: Sets a list of trusted proxies.
setTrustedProxies.long_desc: You should only list the reverse proxies that you manage directly.

trustedHeaderSet.name: trustedHeaderSet
trustedHeaderSet.short_desc: A bit field of Request::HEADER_*, to set which headers to trust from your proxies

getTrustedProxies.name: getTrustedProxies
getTrustedProxies.short_desc: Gets the list of trusted proxies.

getTrustedHeaderSet.name: getTrustedHeaderSet
getTrustedHeaderSet.short_desc: Gets the set of trusted headers from trusted proxies.
getTrustedHeaderSet.hint_desc: A bit field of Request::HEADER_* that defines which headers are trusted from your proxies

setTrustedHosts.name: setTrustedHosts
setTrustedHosts.short_desc: Sets a list of trusted host patterns.
setTrustedHosts.long_desc: You should only list the hosts you manage using regexs.

hostPatterns.name: hostPatterns
hostPatterns.short_desc: A list of trusted host patterns

getTrustedHosts.name: getTrustedHosts
getTrustedHosts.short_desc: Gets the list of trusted host patterns.
getTrustedHosts.hint_desc: An array of trusted host patterns

normalizeQueryString.name: normalizeQueryString
normalizeQueryString.long_desc:
It builds a normalized query string, where keys/value pairs are alphabetized,
have consistent escaping and unneeded delimiters are removed.
normalizeQueryString.hint_desc: A normalized query string for the Request

enableHttpMethodParameterOverride.name: enableHttpMethodParameterOverride
enableHttpMethodParameterOverride.short_desc: Enables support for the _method request parameter to determine the intended HTTP method.
enableHttpMethodParameterOverride.long_desc:
Be warned that enabling this feature might lead to CSRF issues in your code.
Check that you are using CSRF tokens when required.
If the HTTP method parameter override is enabled, an html-form with method "POST" can be altered
and used to send a "PUT" or "DELETE" request via the _method request parameter.
If these methods are not protected against CSRF, this presents a possible vulnerability.

The HTTP method can only be overridden when the real HTTP method is POST.

getHttpMethodParameterOverride.name: getHttpMethodParameterOverride
getHttpMethodParameterOverride.short_desc: Checks whether support for the _method request parameter is enabled.
getHttpMethodParameterOverride.hint_desc: True when the _method request parameter is enabled, false otherwise

hasPreviousSession.name: hasPreviousSession
hasPreviousSession.short_desc:
Whether the request contains a Session which was started in one of the
previous requests.

hasSession.name: hasSession
hasSession.short_desc: Whether the request contains a Session object.
hasSession.long_desc:
This method does not give any information about the state of the session object,
like whether the session is started or not. It is just a way to check if this Request
is associated with a Session instance.
hasSession.hint_desc: true when the Request contains a Session object, false otherwise

getClientIps.name: getClientIps
getClientIps.long_desc:
In the returned array the most trusted IP address is first, and the
least trusted one last. The "real" client IP address is the last one,
but this is also the least trusted one. Trusted proxies are stripped.

Use this method carefully; you should use getClientIp() instead.

getClientIp.name: getClientIp
getClientIp.long_desc:
This method can read the client IP address from the "X-Forwarded-For" header
when trusted proxies were set via "setTrustedProxies()". The "X-Forwarded-For"
header value is a comma+space separated list of IP addresses, the left-most
being the original client, and each successive proxy that passed the request
adding the IP address where it received the request from.

getPathInfo.name: getPathInfo
getPathInfo.short_desc: Returns the path being requested relative to the executed script.
getPathInfo.long_desc:
The path info always starts with a /.

Suppose this request is instantiated from /mysite on localhost:

 * http://localhost/mysite              returns an empty string
 * http://localhost/mysite/about        returns '/about'
 * http://localhost/mysite/enco%20ded   returns '/enco%20ded'
 * http://localhost/mysite/about?var=1  returns '/about'

getBasePath.name: getBasePath
getBasePath.short_desc: Returns the root path from which this request is executed.
getBasePath.long_desc:
Suppose that an index.php file instantiates this request object:

 * http://localhost/index.php         returns an empty string
 * http://localhost/index.php/page    returns an empty string
 * http://localhost/web/index.php     returns '/web'
 * http://localhost/we%20b/index.php  returns '/we%20b'

getBaseUrl.name: getBaseUrl
getBaseUrl.short_desc: Returns the root URL from which this request is executed.
getBaseUrl.long_desc:
The base URL never ends with a /.

This is similar to getBasePath(), except that it also includes the
script filename (e.g. index.php) if one exists.

getPort.name: getPort
getPort.short_desc: Returns the port on which the request is made.
getPort.long_desc:
This method can read the client port from the "X-Forwarded-Port" header
when trusted proxies were set via "setTrustedProxies()".

The "X-Forwarded-Port" header must contain the client port.
getPort.hint_desc: can be a string if fetched from the server bag

getUserInfo.name: getUserInfo
getUserInfo.hint_desc: A user name and, optionally, scheme-specific information about how to gain authorization to access the server

getHttpHost.name: getHttpHost
getHttpHost.short_desc: Returns the HTTP host being requested.
getHttpHost.long_desc: The port name will be appended to the host if it's non-standard.

getRequestUri.name: getRequestUri
getRequestUri.short_desc: Returns the requested URI (path and query string).
getRequestUri.hint_desc: The raw URI (i.e. not URI decoded)

getSchemeAndHttpHost.name: getSchemeAndHttpHost
getSchemeAndHttpHost.short_desc: Gets the scheme and HTTP host.
getSchemeAndHttpHost.long_desc:
If the URL was called with basic authentication, the user
and the password are not added to the generated string.

getUri.name: getUri
getUri.short_desc: Generates a normalized URI (URL) for the Request.
getUri.hint_desc: A normalized URI (URL) for the Request

getUriForPath.name: getUriForPath
getUriForPath.short_desc: Generates a normalized URI for the given path.
getUriForPath.hint_desc: The normalized URI for the path

path.name: path
path.short_desc: A path to use instead of the current one

getRelativeUriForPath.name: getRelativeUriForPath
getRelativeUriForPath.short_desc: Returns the path as relative reference from the current Request path.
getRelativeUriForPath.long_desc:
Only the URIs path component (no schema, host etc.) is relevant and must be given.
Both paths must be absolute and not contain relative parts.
Relative URLs from one resource to another are useful when generating self-contained downloadable document archives.
Furthermore, they can be used to reduce the link size in documents.

Example target paths, given a base path of "/a/b/c/d":
- "/a/b/c/d"     -> ""
- "/a/b/c/"      -> "./"
- "/a/b/"        -> "../"
- "/a/b/c/other" -> "other"
- "/a/x/y"       -> "../../x/y"

getQueryString.name: getQueryString
getQueryString.short_desc: Generates the normalized query string for the Request.
getQueryString.long_desc:
It builds a normalized query string, where keys/value pairs are alphabetized
and have consistent escaping.
getQueryString.hint_desc: A normalized query string for the Request

isSecure.name: isSecure
isSecure.short_desc: Checks whether the request is secure or not.
isSecure.long_desc:
This method can read the client protocol from the "X-Forwarded-Proto" header
when trusted proxies were set via "setTrustedProxies()".

The "X-Forwarded-Proto" header must contain the protocol: "https" or "http".

getHost.name: getHost
getHost.long_desc:
This method can read the client host name from the "X-Forwarded-Host" header
when trusted proxies were set via "setTrustedProxies()".

The "X-Forwarded-Host" header must contain the client host name.
exceptions: when the host name is invalid or not trusted

getMethod.name: getMethod
getMethod.long_desc:
If the X-HTTP-Method-Override header is set, and if the method is a POST,
then it is used to determine the "real" intended HTTP method.

The _method request parameter can also be used to determine the HTTP method,
but only if enableHttpMethodParameterOverride() has been called.

The method is always an uppercased string.

getMimeType.name: getMimeType
getMimeType.short_desc: Gets the mime type associated with the format.
getMimeType.hint_desc: The associated mime type (null if not found)

getMimeTypes.name: getMimeTypes
getMimeTypes.short_desc: Gets the mime types associated with the format.

getFormat.name: getFormat
getFormat.short_desc: Gets the format associated with the mime type.

setFormat.name: setFormat
setFormat.short_desc: Associates a format with mime types.

mimeTypes.name: mimeTypes
mimeTypes.short_desc: The associated mime types (the preferred one must be the first as it will be used as the content type)

getRequestFormat.name: getRequestFormat
getRequestFormat.long_desc:
Here is the process to determine the format:

 * format defined by the user (with setRequestFormat())
 * _format request attribute
 * $default

getContentType.name: getContentType
getContentType.short_desc: Gets the format associated with the request.
getContentType.hint_desc: The format (null if no content type is present)

isMethod.name: isMethod
isMethod.short_desc: Checks if the request method is of specified type.

isMethodSafe.name: isMethodSafe
isMethodSafe.short_desc: Checks whether or not the method is safe.
errors: "0" @param tags are expected but only "1" found

isMethodIdempotent.name: isMethodIdempotent
isMethodIdempotent.short_desc: Checks whether or not the method is idempotent.

isMethodCacheable.name: isMethodCacheable
isMethodCacheable.short_desc: Checks whether the method is cacheable or not.

getProtocolVersion.name: getProtocolVersion
getProtocolVersion.long_desc:
If the application is behind a proxy, the protocol version used in the
requests between the client and the proxy and between the proxy and the
server might be different. This returns the former (from the "Via" header)
if the proxy is trusted (see "setTrustedProxies()"), otherwise it returns
the latter (from the "SERVER_PROTOCOL" server parameter).

getContent.name: getContent
getContent.hint_desc: The request body content or a resource to read the body stream

asResource.name: asResource
asResource.short_desc: If true, a resource will be returned

locales.name: locales
locales.short_desc: An array of ordered available locales

getLanguages.name: getLanguages
getLanguages.short_desc: Gets a list of languages acceptable by the client browser.
getLanguages.hint_desc: Languages ordered in the user browser preferences

getCharsets.name: getCharsets
getCharsets.short_desc: Gets a list of charsets acceptable by the client browser.
getCharsets.hint_desc: List of charsets in preferable order

getEncodings.name: getEncodings
getEncodings.short_desc: Gets a list of encodings acceptable by the client browser.
getEncodings.hint_desc: List of encodings in preferable order

getAcceptableContentTypes.name: getAcceptableContentTypes
getAcceptableContentTypes.short_desc: Gets a list of content types acceptable by the client browser.
getAcceptableContentTypes.hint_desc: List of content types in preferable order

isXmlHttpRequest.name: isXmlHttpRequest
isXmlHttpRequest.short_desc: Returns true if the request is a XMLHttpRequest.
isXmlHttpRequest.long_desc:
It works if your JavaScript library sets an X-Requested-With HTTP header.
It is known to work with common JavaScript frameworks:
isXmlHttpRequest.hint_desc: true if the request is an XMLHttpRequest, false otherwise

isFromTrustedProxy.name: isFromTrustedProxy
isFromTrustedProxy.short_desc: Indicates whether this request originated from a trusted proxy.
isFromTrustedProxy.long_desc:
This can be useful to determine whether or not to trust the
contents of a proxy-specific header.
isFromTrustedProxy.hint_desc: true if the request came from a trusted proxy, false otherwise

matchesType.name: matchesType
matchesType.short_desc: Determine if the given content types match.

isJson.name: isJson
isJson.short_desc: Determine if the request is sending JSON.

expectsJson.name: expectsJson
expectsJson.short_desc: Determine if the current request probably expects a JSON response.

wantsJson.name: wantsJson
wantsJson.short_desc: Determine if the current request is asking for JSON.

accepts.name: accepts
accepts.short_desc: Determines whether the current requests accepts a given content type.

prefers.name: prefers
prefers.short_desc: Return the most suitable content type from the given array based on content negotiation.

acceptsAnyContentType.name: acceptsAnyContentType
acceptsAnyContentType.short_desc: Determine if the current request accepts any content type.

acceptsJson.name: acceptsJson
acceptsJson.short_desc: Determines whether a request accepts JSON.

acceptsHtml.name: acceptsHtml
acceptsHtml.short_desc: Determines whether a request accepts HTML.

format.name: format
format.short_desc: Get the data format expected in the response.

flash.name: flash
flash.short_desc: Flash the input for the current request to the session.

flashOnly.name: flashOnly
flashOnly.short_desc: Flash only some of the input to the session.

flashExcept.name: flashExcept
flashExcept.short_desc: Flash only some of the input to the session.

flush.name: flush
flush.short_desc: Flush all of the old input from the session.

server.name: server
server.short_desc: Retrieve a server variable from the request.

hasHeader.name: hasHeader
hasHeader.short_desc: Determine if a header is set on the request.

header.name: header
header.short_desc: Retrieve a header from the request.

bearerToken.name: bearerToken
bearerToken.short_desc: Get the bearer token from the request headers.

exists.name: exists
exists.short_desc: Determine if the request contains a given input item key.

has.name: has
has.short_desc: Determine if the request contains a given input item key.

hasAny.name: hasAny
hasAny.short_desc: Determine if the request contains any of the given inputs.

filled.name: filled
filled.short_desc: Determine if the request contains a non-empty value for an input item.

anyFilled.name: anyFilled
anyFilled.short_desc: Determine if the request contains a non-empty value for any of the given inputs.

keys.name: keys
keys.short_desc: Get the keys for all of the input and files.

all.name: all
all.short_desc: Get all of the input and files for the request.

input.name: input
input.short_desc: Retrieve an input item from the request.

only.name: only
only.short_desc: Get a subset containing the provided keys with values from the input data.

except.name: except
except.short_desc: Get all of the input except for a specified array of items.

query.name: query
query.short_desc: Retrieve a query string item from the request.

post.name: post
post.short_desc: Retrieve a request payload item from the request.

hasCookie.name: hasCookie
hasCookie.short_desc: Determine if a cookie is set on the request.

cookie.name: cookie
cookie.short_desc: Retrieve a cookie from the request.

allFiles.name: allFiles
allFiles.short_desc: Get an array of all of the files on the request.

hasFile.name: hasFile
hasFile.short_desc: Determine if the uploaded data contains a file.

file.name: file
file.short_desc: Retrieve a file from the request.

mixin.name: mixin
mixin.short_desc: Mix another object into the class.
